metadata.titel_preek: Remembering Who We Are: The Temptation to Amnesia

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The maintenance of identity through memory and resistance against the seduction of amnesia.

subject.identificatie: The Human Self / The Believer (as an agent of memory and resistance)
tekstueel_bewijs: we are never finished with the work of settling our identity
we gladly put my life down in this identity
we must take great care to remember
it takes a village or a community or a family to give us our name
Israelite boys and girls... publicly announce their name

ontvanger.identificatie: The Self / The World (as beneficiary of the church's mission)
tekstueel_bewijs: the church loses its edge for mission
for the sake of the world

helper.identificatie: The Biblical Narrative / Liturgical Recital / Jesus as Example
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus answers the devil... like a true Israelite
Our gift from God: To answer, to resist, to remember
helper.rol_van_god: God is primarily the Object of memory or the Sender of the gift, rather than the active Subject of the present struggle.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (promised spirit) but focus is on human 'remembering'.

tegenstander.identificatie: The Devil / Seduction / Amnesia / U.S. Culture
tekstueel_bewijs: seduction of power, self-indulgence, and anxiety
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is framed as a 'quiet voice' or 'seduction' that 'talks us out' of things, suggesting a battle of the will and mind rather than a cosmic bondage requiring a Savior.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God's historical deliverance of Israel (The Exodus narrative).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (Human remembering) uses the secondary program (God's past action) as the content/fuel for its own performance.

voorbeelden_mens_subject: we are never finished with the work
we must take great care to remember
we imagine we can flex our muscle

voorbeelden: we must take great care to remember
he must be about his father’s work
The temptation... to have a better life
whereby we know to trust Christ

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a 'Recruitment' narrative. It focuses on the struggle of the will (Vouloir) against seduction. It assumes the hearer has the Devoir (obligation) and Savoir (knowledge), but the Pouvoir (power) is treated as a 'gift' that is activated by the human choice to 'remember'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S1 (Baptism) to S2 (Temptation/Culture) to ~S2 (Resistance through Recital) back to S1 (Identity).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is achieved through the human act of 'answering' and 'remembering'.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is treated as a persuasive voice rather than a terminal condition.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the content is deeply biblical and mentions God's past acts, the actantial engine is anthropocentric. The 'work' of the sermon is to urge the human subject to maintain their identity. God is the object of memory, not the active subject of the present transformation.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: it is the work of a lifetime; we are never finished with the work of settling our identity.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God saw our pitiful situation and heard our pain and acted in power.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is presented as the ultimate 'True Israelite' who shows us how to use Scripture to resist temptation.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Jesus does not just resist as our example; He resists as our Substitute because we have already succumbed to the seduction.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform the 'work' of remembering; anxiety about 'forgetting'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is contingent on the continuity of human memory.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from Israel to Jesus to the US Church is rhetorically smooth but structurally shifts the burden of action onto the hearer.
spanning_punten: Baptism is called a 'mystery' and 'gift' but described as a 'task' and 'work'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The story exhibits Jesus as firm in his identity... Luke turns to us and asks, 'What about you?'

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is 'promised' but the 'work' is done by the community and the individual.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'amnesia'—a cognitive and volitional failure rather than a deadness of soul.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as an exhortation for the human subject to use God's past actions as a tool for present self-constitution.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the subject of 'remembering' and 'resisting'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make the Holy Spirit the Subject who 'brings to remembrance' and 'keeps' the believer.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We must take care to remember,' use 'The Spirit of God holds our identity for us when we are too weak to remember.'

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'wandering Aramean' who is currently lost in amnesia and needs to be found.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that the 'gift' provides the 'ability' which we lack.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just 'forgetfulness,' the solution is just 'reminders.' If the opponent is Death, the solution must be Resurrection.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God names us) must precede and sustain Ethics (We live out that name).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a beautiful grasp of the biblical narrative but risks turning the Gospel into a psychological task of memory management. Shift the weight from 'our work of settling identity' to 'God's work of unsettling our amnesia.'

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, this is brilliant and persuasive; semiotically, it is a law-heavy recruitment program.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of Deut 26 is accurate, but the application to the hearer shifts the actantial Subject from God (the deliverer) to the Hearer (the reciter).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the 'grace' language of baptism, the 'Subject' of the active verbs remains the human 'we', making the sermon structurally moralistic.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Exemplar' model of Christology.
